messages.title: A full acute hospital for Hemel
messages.content: I will continue to fight for a full acute hospital for the people of Hemel Hempstead. Never forget Labour closed our hospital.

messages.title: Jobs and welfare
messages.content: I will continue my support for our local businesses and the rebirth of the Maylands business area following the Buncefield disaster.

messages.title: Crime - It's time to fight back
messages.content: I welcome Conservative plans to restore responsibility and discretion to our police and I will fight any attempt to downgrade our Police Station.

messages.title: Making families stronger
messages.content: I will back reforms to our tax and benefits system to help support families and help people balance their lives.

messages.title: Controlling immigration
messages.content: I will support controlled immigration with a limit on numbers, so we only admit those who will benefit the economy.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Mike Penning pledges to continue the fight for a full acute hospital for Hemel Hempstead, remembering that Labour closed the hospital previously.
Commitment to support local businesses and facilitate the rebirth of the Maylands business area after the Buncefield disaster.
Plans to restore responsibility and discretion to police, resisting any efforts to downgrade the Police Station.
Reforms to tax and benefits to strengthen families and to help people balance work and family life.
Supporting controlled immigration with limits to ensure that newcomers benefit the economy.

mentions.candidate: Mike Penning was first elected as Member of Parliament for Hemel Hempstead in 2005 and in 2007 was appointed as a Shadow Minister for Health.

issues.economy: Mike Penning has fought for compensation for residents and businesses affected by the Buncefield disaster.
issues.health: Mike Penning pledges to continue the fight for a full acute hospital for Hemel Hempstead.
issues.immigration: Mike Penning supports controlled immigration with a limit on numbers to benefit the economy.
issues.socialWelfare: Mike Penning intends to back reforms to tax and benefits to support families.

leaflet.personalStatement: Mike Penning lives in Hemel's Old Town, is married to Angela and has two daughters Adele and Abby.

politicalExperience.role: Member of Parliament for Hemel Hempstead
politicalExperience.achievements: First elected as MP in 2005, appointed as a Shadow Minister for Health in 2007

images.caption: Mike Penning with another individual in what appears to be a discussion.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet provides a personal background of Mike Penning, his family, and his military service. Emphasizes his local connections and previous efforts for the community.
